analyzed: bdag gi sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bgyi'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa dang so so'i skye bo ma lus pa'i bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: I rejoice in the merit of all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, noble ones, and ordinary beings without exception.

original: bdag 'di nas byang chub kyi bar du rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: bdag 'di nas byang chub kyi bar du rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o //

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshogs kyi chos la skyabs su mchi'o // phyir mi ldogs pa'i byang chub @368a * //

original: dpa'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: dpa'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to the Sangha, the assembly of irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
translated: I generate the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i bar ji srid du de rnams la mchog tu mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la dgod pa'i slad du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ma lus pa la bdag gi lus
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i bar ji srid du de rnams la mchog tu mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la dgod pa'i slad du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ma lus pa la bdag gi lus
translated: For the sake of establishing all sentient beings in the supreme, ultimate nirvāṇa of buddhahood, I offer my body to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas without exception.

original: dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: I offer my speech and mind as well.🔽I dedicate all these virtues to unsurpassed awakening.

original: dge ba 'di dag thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o zhes byas la yi ge brgya pa brjod pas bcom ldan 'das mnyes par byas te /🔽aom shr'i he ru ka sa ma ya /🔽ma nu p'a la ya he ru ka tve no pa tishtha dri dho me bha ba /🔽su to shyo me bha ba /🔽aa nu ra kto me bha ba /

translated: Recite the hundred-syllable mantra to please the Bhagavat.

original: su po shyo me bha ba /🔽sarba siddhimme pra yatstsha /🔽sarba karma su tsa me tsittam shre ya: ku ru h'um /🔽ha ha ha ha ho: bha ga w'an /

translated: Oṃ śrī heruka samayam anupālaya heruka tvenopatiṣṭha dṛḍho me bhava sutoṣyo me bhava anurakto me bhava supoṣyo me bhava sarvasiddhim me prayaccha sarvakarma suca me cittaṃ śreyaḥ kuru hūṃ ha ha ha ha hoḥ bhagavān /

original: sarbba ta th'a ga ta badzra m'a me munytsa badzr'i bha ba ma h'a sa ma ya sa tva a'a: badzra mu: zhes bya bas gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: sarbba ta th'a ga ta badzra m'a me munytsa badzr'i bha ba ma h'a sa ma ya sa tva a'a: badzra mu: zhes bya bas gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: Sarvatathāgatabīja vajra māṃ muñca vajrī bhava mahāsamayasatva āḥ. Vajra muḥ.

original: de nas sems can thams cad las lha'i bde ba nye bar sbyor ba'i rnam pa'i byams pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad se la bar byed pa'i rnam pa'i snying rje dang / lha'i bde ba rgyun mi 'chad par nges pa'i rnam pa'i dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de nas sems can thams cad las lha'i bde ba nye bar sbyor ba'i rnam pa'i byams pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad se la bar byed pa'i rnam pa'i snying rje dang / lha'i bde ba rgyun mi 'chad par nges pa'i rnam pa'i dga' ba dang /
translated: Then one should cultivate love in the aspect of applying divine bliss to all sentient beings, compassion in the aspect of removing all suffering, joy in the aspect of the continuity of divine bliss,

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i lam nye bar sbyor ba'i rnam pa'i btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i lam nye bar sbyor ba'i rnam pa'i btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and equanimity in the aspect of applying the antidote to the afflictions and branch afflictions.

original: de'i rjes la chos thams cad yid kyis dmigs te sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bur nye bar brtags la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la chos thams cad yid kyis dmigs te sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bur nye bar brtags la /
translated: After that, one should mentally observe all phenomena and examine them as being like illusions and dreams.

original: ston ka'i nyi ma gung gi nam mkha' dri ma med pa'i dkyil lta bur chos thams cad mngon du byas te /
analyzed: ston ka'i nyi ma gung gi nam mkha' dri ma med pa'i dkyil lta bur chos thams cad mngon du byas te /
translated: Then, like the center of a stainless autumn sky at midday, one should manifest all phenomena.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate with the mantra, “Oṃ śūnyatājñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ. ”

original: de'i rjes la yi ge h'um las bdag nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dpal he ru ka'i gzugs sku mdog dang mtshon char ldan pa mngon par sprul la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la yi ge h'um las bdag nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dpal he ru ka'i gzugs sku mdog dang mtshon char ldan pa mngon par sprul la /
translated: After that, from the syllable hūṃ, one should emanate oneself in the form of Śrī Heruka as will be described, with color and weapons,

original: snying ga'i sa bon gyi lcags kyus phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs bkug ste khron par chud par byas la /
analyzed: snying ga'i sa bon gyi lcags kyus phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs bkug ste khron par chud par byas la /
translated: and with the hook of the seed syllable in the heart one should summon the hosts of obstructors dwelling in the ten directions and throw them into the pit.

original: khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad kyi phur bus gdab bo //
analyzed: khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad kyi phur bus gdab bo //
translated: One should drive them in with the stakes of the eight goddesses beginning with Kākāsyā.

original: lha mo de rnams sku @368b mdog dmar po 'bar ba gsal zhing /
analyzed: lha mo de rnams sku @368b mdog dmar po 'bar ba gsal zhing /
translated: Those goddesses are red, blazing, and radiant.

original: phyag gnyis pa mgo skyes dmar ser gyen du 'bar ba /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa mgo skyes dmar ser gyen du 'bar ba /
translated: They are two-armed, with orange hair blazing upward.

original: gri gug dang thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa zhal rnam par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gri gug dang thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa zhal rnam par 'gyur ba /
translated: They hold flaying knives, skulls, and khaṭvāṅgas, and their faces are contorted.

original: smad rtse mo'i rnam par byas pa /
analyzed: smad rtse mo'i rnam par byas pa /
translated: Their lower parts are in the form of a peak.

original: mgo bo'i phreng bas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: mgo bo'i phreng bas brgyan pa'o //
translated: They are adorned with garlands of heads.

original: sngags pas khro bo'i mig gis sngags bzlas shing bgegs rnams khron par chud par byas te /
analyzed: sngags pas khro bo'i mig gis sngags bzlas shing bgegs rnams khron par chud par byas te /
translated: The mantrin, with wrathful eyes, recites the mantra and causes the obstructors to fall into the pit.

original: aom sumbha ni sumbha h'um h'um phat /🔽aom grihna grihna h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom sumbha ni sumbha h'um h'um phat / aom grihna grihna h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, sumbha ni sumbha, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.🔽Oṃ, gṛhṇa gṛhṇa, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom gri hn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom gri hn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a na ya ho: bha ga w'an bidy'a r'a dza h'um h'um phat /🔽shar la sogs par g-yon nas rnam par bskor zhing /
analyzed: aom a'a na ya ho: bha ga w'an bidy'a r'a dza h'um h'um phat / shar la sogs par g-yon nas rnam par bskor zhing /
translated: Oṃ, ānayaho bhagavān vidyā rāja, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.🔽[One should] place [the vajra] in the east, etc., turning to the left,

original: me la sogs par g-yas nas bskor te dgod do //
analyzed: me la sogs par g-yas nas bskor te dgod do //
translated: and in the south, etc., turning to the right.

original: de nas aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba dusht'ana h'um phat /🔽k'i la ya k'i la ya sarba p'a pam h'um phat /
analyzed: de nas aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba dusht'ana h'um phat / k'i la ya k'i la ya sarba p'a pam h'um phat /
translated: Then, oṃ gha gha ghatāya ghatāya sarva duṣṭān hūṃ phaṭ.🔽Kill! Kill! All evil! Hūṃ phaṭ.

original: h'um h'um h'um /
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um /
translated: Hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ.

original: badzra k'i la badzra dha ro a'adzny'a pa ya ti sarba dusht'an k'a ya w'ak tsitta badzra k'i la ya h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: badzra k'i la badzra dha ro a'adzny'a pa ya ti sarba dusht'an k'a ya w'ak tsitta badzra k'i la ya h'um h'um phat /
translated: The vajra kills! The vajra burns! All evil! Body, speech, and mind! Vajra kills! Hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: 'dis spyi bor brtan por bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis spyi bor brtan por bzhag par bya'o //
translated: With this, one should firmly place [the vajra] on the head.

original: aom badzra mudga ra badzra k'i la ya a'a ko ta ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra mudga ra badzra k'i la ya a'a ko ta ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra mudgara vajra kīlaya ākoṭaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: 'dis rdo rje tho bas brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis rdo rje tho bas brdung bar bya'o //
translated: With this, one should strike with the vajra hammer.

original: de nas phur pa'i 'od zer 'bar ba'i 'og tu rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi dang / logs su rdo rje'i ra ba dang / steng du rdo rje gur dang / rdo rje bla re dang / mda'i dra ba dang / phyi rol du rdo rje me 'bar ba bsgoms la sngags kyis kyang brtan par bya ste /

translated: Then, below the blazing light rays of the dagger, one should meditate on a vajra-nature ground, a vajra fence on the sides, a vajra tent above, a vajra canopy, a net of arrows, and a blazing vajra fire outside, and one should stabilize it with the mantras.

original: aom me di ni badzri bha wa badzra bandha h'um /
analyzed: aom me di ni badzri bha wa badzra bandha h'um /

analyzed: aom badzra pr'a k'a ra h'um bam h'um /

original: aom badzra dzva la aa na l'arka h'um ram h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra dzva la aa na l'arka h'um ram h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra jvālānalarka hūṃ raṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

analyzed: sa'i cha bgegs med par bltas la /

translated: After that, opening the vajra palms upward, one should place them well on the head.

original: aom a'a: a'a ra lli ho dza: h'um bam ho: badzra d'a ki n+ya sa ma ya stvam dri shya ho:/
analyzed: aom a'a: a'a ra lli ho dza: h'um bam ho: badzra d'a ki n+ya sa ma ya stvam dri shya ho:/
translated: Oṃ āḥ ārallihoḥ jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, vajra-ḍākinī samaya stvaṃ dṛśyahoḥ.

original: zhes lan gsum mam bzhi 'am lnga ru brjod la /
analyzed: zhes lan gsum mam bzhi 'am lnga ru brjod la /
translated: One should recite this three, four, or five times.

original: gtso po dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la dbul lo //🔽de'i rjes la mchod pa byas la /
analyzed: gtso po dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la dbul lo // de'i rjes la mchod pa byas la /
translated: One should offer it to the maṇḍala wheel together with the principal deity.

original: yang tshigs su bcad pa brjod de /
analyzed: yang tshigs su bcad pa brjod de /
translated: After that, one should make offerings and recite the verse:

original: srid dang zhi bar gyur nas chags pa'i kun rtog rlabs bcom zhing //
analyzed: srid dang zhi bar gyur nas chags pa'i kun rtog rlabs bcom zhing //
translated: Having crossed over existence and peace, having destroyed the waves of conceptualization of passion,

original: de nyid du na dngos po ma lus mkha' bzhin du gzigs pa //
analyzed: de nyid du na dngos po ma lus mkha' bzhin du gzigs pa //
translated: having seen all things just as they are, like space,

original: ches lci thugs rje'i chu yis thugs kyi padma rgyas pa'i mgon //
analyzed: ches lci thugs rje'i chu yis thugs kyi padma rgyas pa'i mgon //
translated: the protector whose lotus of mind is opened by the water of great compassion,

original: lha mo rnams kyis bdag la shin tu thugs brtser mdzod cig mdzod //
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyis bdag la shin tu thugs brtser mdzod cig mdzod //
translated: the goddesses should have great compassion for me.

original: ces bya ba 'dis bstod la gtor ma'i lhag ma mtshan mo rgyu ba rnams la 'dis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis bstod la gtor ma'i lhag ma mtshan mo rgyu ba rnams la 'dis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having praised with this, one should give the remainder of the bali to those moving in the night with this:

original: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi sarbba yaksha r'aksha sa bh'u ta preta pi sh'a tsa aun ma da aa pa sm'a ra gra ha d'a ki n+ya da ya /
analyzed: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi sarbba yaksha r'aksha sa bh'u ta preta pi sh'a tsa aun ma da aa pa sm'a ra gra ha d'a ki n+ya da ya /
translated: Oṃ kha kha khāhi khāhi, all yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, pretas, piśācas, unmadas, apasmāras, grahas, and ḍākinīs,

original: ai mam pa lim gri hnantu /
analyzed: ai mam pa lim gri hnantu /
translated: accept this torma.🔽Protect me with samaya, grant me all powers, and always grant me protection and enjoyments, just as I have requested.

original: sa ma ya rakshantu ma ma sarba siddhi mme pra yatstshantu ya thee bam ya theshtam bhunydza tha pi ba tha m'a me aa ti kra ma tham ma sarbba k'ar ta ya satshu kha bi briddha ye sa ha yi k'a bha bantu aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sa ma ya rakshantu ma ma sarba siddhi mme pra yatstshantu ya thee bam ya theshtam bhunydza tha pi ba tha m'a me aa ti kra ma tham ma sarbba k'ar ta ya satshu kha bi briddha ye sa ha yi k'a bha bantu aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: yi ge brgya pa mu:'i mtha' can bton pas gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: yi ge brgya pa mu:'i mtha' can bton pas gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: Recite the hundred-syllable mantra with muḥ at the end to request the deities to depart.

original: zas kyi dus su sngar bzhin bza' ba thams cad sbyangs te /
analyzed: zas kyi dus su sngar bzhin bza' ba thams cad sbyangs te /
translated: At mealtimes, as before, purify all food.

original: lte ba'i padma'i ze'u 'brur mthe bong gi tshad kyi me rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: lte ba'i padma'i ze'u 'brur mthe bong gi tshad kyi me rnam par bsams la /
translated: Imagine that at the center of the lotus of the navel there is a thumb-sized fire.

original: srog dang rtsol ba bsdams pas me bar tu spar te yid kyi mchod pas mchod la /
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba bsdams pas me bar tu spar te yid kyi mchod pas mchod la /
translated: By restraining the prāṇa and āyāma, the fire blazes. Make mental offerings.

original: de nyid du 'bar ba'i rnam par gyur par bltas nas /
analyzed: de nyid du 'bar ba'i rnam par gyur par bltas nas /
translated: Having seen that it becomes the form of a blazing fire,

original: 'bar ba'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das thugs ka'i sa bon las bskyed la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang lhan cig tu byas nas /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das thugs ka'i sa bon las bskyed la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang lhan cig tu byas nas /
translated: one should generate the Blessed One in the middle of the blazing fire from the seed syllable at the heart, and having made him together with all the Tathagatas,

original: ljags h'um las rdo rjer byung bar bsams te /
analyzed: ljags h'um las rdo rjer byung bar bsams te /
translated: one should imagine that the tongue is a vajra arisen from HŪM.

original: bdud rtsi des sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi des sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should perform the burnt offering with that nectar.

original: nang gi sbyin sreg gi cho ga'o //
analyzed: nang gi sbyin sreg gi cho ga'o //
translated: This is the procedure of the inner burnt offering.

original: mchod pa'i dus su @371a * //
analyzed: mchod pa'i dus su @371a * //
translated: At the time of worship,

original: rang gi reg pa yud tsam gyis phag mo'i gzugs su bltas la sgrub thabs la sogs pa nas gsungs pa'i chogs ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / go cha gnyis dang / lus ngag byin gyis brlabs pa byas nas bdag kyang de bzhin du he ru ka'i rnam par byas te /
analyzed: rang gi reg pa yud tsam gyis phag mo'i gzugs su bltas la sgrub thabs la sogs pa nas gsungs pa'i chogs ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / go cha gnyis dang / lus ngag byin gyis brlabs pa byas nas bdag kyang de bzhin du he ru ka'i rnam par byas te /
translated: having seen one's own touch as the form of Vārāhī for a moment, one should perform the rite taught in the sādhana and so forth, the entry of the gnosis being, the consecration, the two armors, and the consecration of body and speech, and then oneself also becomes in the form of Heruka.

original: yi ge ae las lha mo'i padma 'dab ma gsum pa dang yi ge a'a: las ze'i 'bru'o //
analyzed: yi ge ae las lha mo'i padma 'dab ma gsum pa dang yi ge a'a: las ze'i 'bru'o //
translated: From the syllable E, the goddess's lotus with three petals, and from the syllable Aḥ, the pistil cup.

original: h'um las skyas pa'i rdo rje dang / yi ge aom las skyes pa'i rdo rje dang / de'i bu gar ni phat de /
analyzed: h'um las skyas pa'i rdo rje dang / yi ge aom las skyes pa'i rdo rje dang / de'i bu gar ni phat de /
translated: The vajra born from the syllable hūṃ, and the vajra born from the syllable oṃ, and the syllable phaṭ in the opening of that [vajra].

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga ya mi zhes pa'i sngags dran zhing bskyod pas rab tu dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bkug ste /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga ya mi zhes pa'i sngags dran zhing bskyod pas rab tu dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bkug ste /
translated: Recalling the mantra oṃ sarva tathāgata anurāgāya mi, by shaking [the vajra], the sound of intense joy summons all tathāgatas.

original: kha'i lam nas snying gar zhugs nas /
analyzed: kha'i lam nas snying gar zhugs nas /
translated: They enter through the path of the mouth into the heart.

original: bde ba chen po zhu bar gyur nas rdo rje'i lam nas padmar dbab ba //
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhu bar gyur nas rdo rje'i lam nas padmar dbab ba //
translated: Having melted into great bliss, they descend from the vajra path into the lotus.

original: de nas bdud rtsi de nyid kyis bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bdud rtsi de nyid kyis bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, with that very nectar, one should make offerings to the maṇḍala wheel of oneself.

original: nang gi mchod pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: nang gi mchod pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The ritual of inner offering.

original: de nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems brtan par 'dod pas /
analyzed: de nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems brtan par 'dod pas /
translated: Then, one who wishes to stabilize the mind by the samādhi of the completion stage,

original: a'a li k'a li sngon bsams nas //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li sngon bsams nas //
translated: having previously contemplated the ḍākinīs and ḍākas,

original: rnal 'byor chen po ngal bso ste //🔽lte ba'i dbus su rdzogs pa yi //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po ngal bso ste // lte ba'i dbus su rdzogs pa yi //
translated: the great yogi rests.🔽In the center of the navel,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //
translated: one should meditate on the maṇḍala of the moon.

original: yi ge'i gnas kyi mchog gyur pa //
analyzed: yi ge'i gnas kyi mchog gyur pa //
translated: The supreme place of the syllables

original: de yi dbus su gnas pa bsam //
analyzed: de yi dbus su gnas pa bsam //
translated: is imagined to be in the middle of that.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can //
translated: The one who possesses the vajra of body, speech, and mind

original: lha yi gzugs kyi bsgom par bya //
analyzed: lha yi gzugs kyi bsgom par bya //
translated: should meditate on the form of the deity.

original: de ni gzugs las 'das pa ste //
analyzed: de ni gzugs las 'das pa ste //
translated: That is beyond form,

original: sems nyid du ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sems nyid du ni bsgom par bya //
translated: but should be meditated on as the nature of mind.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab de yang bsam //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab de yang bsam //
translated: The inconceivable should be imagined,

original: sems nyid du nam brtag mi bya //
analyzed: sems nyid du nam brtag mi bya //
translated: but should not be analyzed as the nature of mind.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab de bsams na //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab de bsams na //
translated: When the inconceivable is imagined,

original: de las gzugs ni thob par 'gyur //🔽mnyam med yon tan gter gyur sngom pa'i yi ge bdun pa 'di'i //
analyzed: de las gzugs ni thob par 'gyur // mnyam med yon tan gter gyur sngom pa'i yi ge bdun pa 'di'i //
translated: form is attained from that.🔽By the merit obtained from striving in this practice

original: sgrub thabs 'bad par byas las bsod nams thob pa des //
analyzed: sgrub thabs 'bad par byas las bsod nams thob pa des //
translated: of the seven-syllable mantra, which is a treasure of incomparable good qualities,

original: 'jig rten ma lus pa ni dpa' bo'i dbang po ltar //
analyzed: 'jig rten ma lus pa ni dpa' bo'i dbang po ltar //
translated: may all worlds become like the lord of heroes,🔽and may all beings become of one mind and attain the ultimate.

original: 'gro rnams gcig gyur mthar thug rab tu gnas gyur cig / yi ge bdun pa'i sgrub thabs pandi ta chen po nag po pa'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'gro rnams gcig gyur mthar thug rab tu gnas gyur cig / yi ge bdun pa'i sgrub thabs pandi ta chen po nag po pa'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of the seven-syllable [mantra] composed by the great paṇḍita Kṛṣṇapāda is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ngag gi dbang phyug dang / klog skya shes rab ba rtsegs kyis bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ngag gi dbang phyug dang / klog skya shes rab ba rtsegs kyis bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The Indian abbot Vagisvarakirti and the Tibetan translator Lotsawa Sherab Dray-o

original: slad nas bod kyi lo ts'a ba a'a ts'arya mar pa chos kyi dbang phyug gis zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: slad nas bod kyi lo ts'a ba a'a ts'arya mar pa chos kyi dbang phyug gis zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: Later, the Tibetan translator Acharya Marpa Chokyi Wangchuk revised it.
